metadata.Title: CVE-2019-20630 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in libgpac.a in GPAC before 0.8.0, as demonstratedby MP4Box. It contains a heap-based buffer over-read in BS_ReadByte (calledfrom gf_bs_read_bit) in utils/bitstream.c that can cause a denial ofservice via a crafted MP4 file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-20630` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gpac - 1.0.1+dfsg1-3
gpac-modules-base - 1.0.1+dfsg1-3
libgpac10 - 1.0.1+dfsg1-3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: gpac package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.0.1+dfsg1-3').
